text: Bjørn Gulden (born June 4, 1965) is a Norwegian businessman and former professional football player. He is the CEO of Adidas. He used to be the CEO of Puma and Pandora. He was Fortune's Businessperson of the Year in 2019. == Early life and education == Gulden was born in Zurich, Switzerland. He earned a Bachelors of Business Administration from the University of Stavanger and a Master of Business Administration from Babson College. == Football career == Gulden started his football career for the Strømsgodset Toppfotball team. He later played for 1. FC Nürnberg for the 1984–85 2. Bundesliga season. He later joined Bryne FK. == Business career == Gulden began his career at Adidas in 1992 until 1999, when he became an executive at Helly Hansen. In 2000, he became the managing director of Deichmann SE and was CEO of Deichmann's U.S. subsidiary Rack Room Shoes. Between 2012 and 2013, he served as the CEO of Pandora, a Danish jewelry brand, and remained a board member until 2018. In 2013, he became CEO of German design corporation Puma. He became CEO of Adidas on January 1, 2023, taking over Kasper Rørsted. == Kanye West controversy == On the In Good Company podcast, Gulden defended Kanye West's comments caused the termination of Adidas Yeezy. His comments were widely reported, and he later "apologized for his misstatement." == References == Category:1965 births Category:Living people
